author: Abhijit Lele
title: Finance Ministry uncomfortable with Maharashtra govts criminal action against bank officers News
text:
Displeased with criminal action initiated by Maharashtra government against bank officials for failing to release funds to farmers, the Union Finance Ministry has stepped in to stop victimsation of officers working with Public sector banks in state.
The ministry has asked PSBs including Bank of Maharashtra and Dena Bank, whose officials faced wrath of state-government action, to take up matter with the government in the state.
Last month state chief minister Devendra Fadnavis had warned banks against shortcomings in extending financial assistance to farmers. Consequently, some district collectors in Maharashtra initiated criminal proceedings under Indian Penal Code against two dozen branch managers of public sector and cooperative banks that allegedly missed the targets.
The state government charged that officers with district central cooperative banks had failed to give financial assistance to tackle the agrarian crisis.
Expressing displeasure over action against branch managers, senior finance ministry official said department of financial services is aware of development and will take up raise issue with state government. At first instance the concerned banks should take up issue state (government) and ministry will do a follow-up with government, official told Business Standard.
Bank of Maharashtra (BoM) Officials confirmed that department of financial services has written to the state government. The, however, declined to elaborate on contents of communication.
Indian Bank's Association (IBA), banking industry lobby group, has sought Reserve Bank of India's intervention to halt such "un-warranted" step.
The State Level Bankers' Committee (SLBC) for Maharashtra would be pursuing the matter. BoM, Pune-based public sector lender is convener of SLBC, IBA officials said. The SLBC is a consultative and coordination body of all financial institutions operating in each state. The panel is expected to discuss issues, consider alternative solutions to the various problems in the field of banking development.
Meanwhile, All India Bank Employees Association (AIBEA) in a statement said Bank employees are espousing the cause of small peasantry. It has taken up matters with ministry and opposed such unwarranted attacks on bank employees.
